nodes.text: There have been several exclusive Star Wars audio drama adaptations produced in the German language. While Star Wars literature is translated into many languages worldwide, and standard audiobooks in which a narrator reads the complete or abridged text of a novel exist in many of those languages, the German licensees have created several full-cast dramatizations along the lines of the English-language radio drama adaptations of the original trilogy. These unique adaptations, known as Hörspiele in German, form an extensive body of audio media with no direct English-language equivalent.
In total, eleven theatrical films, five novels, one animated television movie, and 76 animated television episodes have been adapted into German-language audio dramas, across 71 total compact discs.
The WortArt label created adaptations of the original and prequel trilogies and two Legends novels between 2004 and 2008:
IMAGA adapted Timothy Zahn's Thrawn trilogy between 2012 and 2014:

Universal Music's German division adapted the sequel trilogy, the two Star Wars Story films, the first two seasons of Star Wars: The Clone Wars, the premiere movie for Star Wars Rebels, and the first two seasons of Rebels with the exception of the second-season finale, between 2011 and 2020.
